segments.text: I glance at the kitchen and spot the woman first.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She's in an apron, looking content with her dish towel.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But oh no, the sink is spilling water all over.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's cascading down like a waterfall onto the floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She hasn't noticed, her back half-turned.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: To her left, the boy's on the stool, arm in the cookie jar.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: That stool is leaning dangerously, ready to flip.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: He's holding a plate too, probably to hide his snack.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is right there, palm up, excited for her cookie.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Cabinets open wide, everything so accessible.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Sunlight from the window lights up the garden nicely.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's a shame the inside is such a hazard zone.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel bad for them, this could end in tears.
segments.speaker: PAR
